title: Accountant Job at FGS Limited
content:
FGS Limited, an Oil and Gas Company is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Plan, executing the company’s financial strategy.
	Developing plans for growth to increase company profit while also reducing expenditure.
	Identifying investment opportunities and managing mergers and acquisitions.
	Assisting the Managing Director (MD) to develop financial plans.
	Managing accounting procedures.
	Analysing data and creating models based on the analysis.
	Work in conjunction with all department heads to ensure maximum profitability and strategize ways to minimize waste and control costs.
	Provide critical assessment of all budgets and cost projections.
	Ensure the Company’s compliance with relevant statutory law and financial regulations.
	Liaising with internal and external auditors to ensure periodic monitoring.
	Develop financial strategy, including risk minimization plans and opportunity forecasting.
	Conducting reviews and evaluations for cost reduction as well as monitoring actual versus budgeted expenses.
	Develop actionable business strategies and plans that ensure alignment with short-term and long-term objectives developed in alignment with the MD.
	Ensures strategic objectives are shaped at the Executive Management level and are translated into tactical business plans with mechanisms for key measurements in place to monitor progress.
	Ensure the accuracy, reliability, completeness, and integrity of the Company’s financial statement in line with local and international statutory standards (GAAP, IFRS, etc).
	Produce and analyse periodic results and KPIs (Financial & Operations) in accordance with the company’s policies.
	Coordinate the Company’s annual statutory audit and periodic review activities with independent auditors.
	Supervision of the finance/account officers and assistants.
	Overseeing the preparation and analysis of accurate and timely financial reports (e.g., income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements).
	Prepare the Company’s annual budgets and quarterly forecasts.
	Ensure Standard Operating procedures and internal control policies in place are strictly adhered to.
	Developing strategies and plans for the long-term financial goals of the organization as well as directing budgets to meet these goals.
	Monitor and control cash flow to enable the organization to meet its business and investment needs.
	Setting credit rating criteria, determining credit ceilings, monitoring of receivables, aging, and following up with payment.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or a related field.
	Minimum of 14 - 16 years of financial management experience, with at least 5 - 7 years in a leadership role.
	Professional certification (e.g., ACCA, CPA, CFA) is preferred.
	Strong knowledge of financial regulations, accounting principles, and tax laws.
	Experience with financial planning, budgeting, and investment analysis.
	Strong leadership and team management skills.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Proficiency in financial software and ERP systems.
	Strong communication and presentation skills.
	Ability to work strategically while managing financial details effectively.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: robertituboala@gmail.com or: info@fleesglobal.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Customer Support Specialist Job at Ledgeris
content:
Ledgeris is revolutionizing back-office outsourcing by offering agile, cost-effective, and high-quality support tailored to your business needs. We specialize in creating dedicated teams that seamlessly integrate with your operations, adopting your preferred tools and processes to ensure smooth collaboration and high efficiency.Our approach allows you to focus on scaling your core business while we handle the rest.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



With a commitment to excellence, Ledgeris provides premium talent without the premium price tag.Our professionals are rigorously vetted, highly skilled, and deeply committed to delivering top-tier results.Leveraging AI to enhance decision-making and eliminate inefficiencies, we combine human expertise with technological innovation to offer smarter, faster, and more human outsourcing solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Support Specialist
Job Location: Benin City, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a Customer Support Specialist who will act as a key point of contact, providing exceptional customer service, and resolving inquiries.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide timely and accurate support through phone, email, or chat channels.
	Assist with inquiries and appointment scheduling.
	Resolve complex customer issues while ensuring compliance with regulations and confidentiality protocols.
	Document and track customer interactions in the system, ensuring accurate records for follow-up and reporting purposes.
	Identify potential issues and escalate them appropriately to ensure swift resolution.
	Offer guidance to customers.
	Work closely with internal teams to ensure smooth communication.
	Provide feedback and recommendations for process improvements, training, and tools to enhance customer satisfaction.
	Ensure the highest level of customer service while maintaining professionalism and empathy when interacting with customers.


Requirements


	At least 1 year of customer service experience.
	Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.
	Experience with BPO customer support is preferred.
	Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information while adhering to compliance rules and regulations.
	Proficiency in using customer service software and office productivity tools.
	Ability to manage multiple inquiries simultaneously and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
	Detail-oriented with strong organizational and problem-solving skills.
	A positive attitude and a passion for providing excellent customer service.


Benefits


	Growth Plan:Develop your skills and grow professionally.

title: Senior Procurement Manager Job at Maurice Xandra Solutions Limited
content:
Maurice Xandra Solutions Limited is a management consulting company that renders quality services in Human Resource, Management and Process improvement. MXS Limited was set up to provide high quality, up to date training, team management and process improvement services for its clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Procurement Manager 

Job Location: Lagos

Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Senior Procurement Manager will be responsible for building and managing procurement functions that support business needs across technology, marketing, logistics, retail operations, and more.
	This is a strategic role for a results-driven professional who understands how to operate in a fast-moving, Performance-led business environment.


key Responsibilities


	Establish and lead the Procurement function across all company operations—digital, retail, and infrastructure.
	Develop and execute a comprehensive sourcing and procurement strategy tailored to business priorities.
	Define procurement policies, workflows, and performance KPIs to drive efficiency and accountability.
	Lead and manage the procurement team, ensuring optimal daily operations and adherence to best practices.
	Negotiate contracts and service agreements that protect company interests and meet SLA expectations.
	Oversee vendor performance reviews and drive continuous improvement.
	Ensure full compliance with Nigerian procurement laws corporate governance standards, and internal controls.
	Supervise procurement activities for key categories: IT hardware/software, retail materials, marketing assets, logistics, office equipment, and facility services.
	Ensure real-time tracking and transparency of all procurement activities.
	Build and maintain strong supplier relationships to ensure quality, cost-effectiveness, and reliability.
	Develop and enforce internal procurement policies and procedures.
	Identify procurement risks and implement strategies to mitigate supply disruptions or overdependence.
	Conduct regular market and cost analysis to identify savings opportunities and optimise value.
	Drive bulk purchasing, strategic sourcing, and supplier diversification to support business sustainability.
	Track budget performance and align procurement spend with financial targets.
	Oversee procurement systems and tools (e.g., ERP platforms like QuickBooks or others).Collaborate with Finance to ensure seamless integration of procurement workflows and transaction tracking.
	Continuously optimise system-based approval processes, requisition tracking, and purchase order management.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Supply Chain Management, Engineering, or a related field. An MBA or relevant certifications (e.g., CIPS, CPSM) is an added advantage.
	8+ years of progressive procurement experience, with a minimum of 3 years in a senior leadership role, ideally in technology, telecoms, or gaming sectors
	Strong commercial negotiation skills and experience managing contracts and service level agreements.
	Familiarity with ERP/procurement systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Coupa) and procurement analytics.
	Proven ability to deliver cost efficiencies, drive process improvements, and manage supplier relationships.
	Excellent stakeholder management, communication, and team leadership skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candiates should send their CV to: hr@mauricexandra.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Vacancies at Lily Hospitals Limited
content:
LiLily Hospitals Limited was established since 1986 remains one of the foremost hospitals in Nigeria and within the South-South region of the country. It is the first private hospital in Nigeria to achieve ISO 9001:2000 quality management system certification from the Standards Organization of Nigeria (SON) and was also recently accredited with COHSASA (Council for Health Service Accreditation of Southern Africa) Certificate.

We are recruiting suitable candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Junior Registrar - Radiology

Job Location: Warri, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Join our structured Residency Training Program in Radiology. As a Junior Registrar, you will gain hands-on experience across major imaging modalities such as X-ray, CT, MRI, Ultrasound; while learning under expert consultants in a supportive academic environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct and report radiological investigations
	Attend clinical teaching & academic sessions
	Maintain detailed, accurate patient records
	Work closely with consultants & allied professionals
	Adhere to ethical, safety & clinical best practices


Eligibility Criteria


	MBBS (with full license)
	Completed Internship & NYSC
	Passed Primaries in Radiology (NPMCN or WACS)
	Strong interest in imaging, diagnosis & research.


What We Offer


	Attractive Pay Package - Earn above N500,000 monthly
	Structured Residency & Training
	Dedicated Consultant Mentorship
	Research & Career Development Support
	A progressive, teaching-driven work culture.


Application Closing Date: 18th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV & Credentials to: recruitment@lilyhospitals.net using "Junior Registrar - Radiology” as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Clinical Quality Lead

Job Location: Warri, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a driven and quality-focused Clinical Quality Lead to support the delivery of excellent patient care across our hospital group.
	In this role, you will guide a team of clinical professionals, lead routine quality assessments, and help embed continuous improvement practices within the clinical environment.
	This position is ideal for a healthcare professional with a solid clinical background and a growing track record in quality assurance, supportive supervision, and health systems strengthening.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead implementation of quality improvement initiatives across hospital units
	Conduct Gemba rounds to assess frontline clinical practices and identify service gaps
	Oversee team-based learning activities, training programs, and technical mentorship
	Track clinical KPIs and report progress toward care standards and safety benchmarks
	Drive internal quality audits, performance reviews, and feedback processes
	Support accreditation readiness (e.g., ISO, COHSASA) and regulatory compliance
	Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to standardize and sustain best practices.


Requirements


	MBBS from a recognized institution (mandatory)
	5 - 7 years of clinical experience, including 2+ years in quality, supervision, or health program management roles
	Postgraduate qualification in Public Health, Health Management, or related field is an advantage
	Demonstrated experience in quality improvement, supportive supervision, or clinical mentorship
	Familiarity with Kaizen/Lean principles and healthcare accreditation frameworks (e.g., ISO, COHSASA)
	Strong communication, analytical, and leadership skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and clinical data tools (DHIS2, Kobo Collect, etc.) is desirable.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Opportunities for professional growth and development.
	A supportive and collaborative work environment.


Application Closing Date: 17th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and credentials to: recruitment@lilyhospitals.net using "Clinical Quality Lead" as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Logistics Officer

Job Location: Warri, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Logistics Officer will ensure timely transportation, and distribution of goods and services to meet the hospital’s operational needs efficiently.


Key Responsibilities


	Implement systems to track and report on inventory usage and waste.
	Oversee the hospital’s transport and logistics activities, including managing delivery schedules.
	Provide regular updates on the status of logistics operations.
	Ensure all logistics activities comply with relevant policies, procedures, and regulations.
	Ensure the hospital’s vehicles are well-maintained and compliant with safety standards.
	Work closely with departments to understand their logistics needs and ensure timely delivery of required items.
	Periodically evaluate suppliers and contractors to ensure consistent quality and reliability.


Qualifications and Skills
Education:


	Bachelor’s Degree or HND in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.


Experience:


	Minimum of 2 years of experience in logistics preferably in the healthcare industry.


Skills:


	Strong organizational and problem-solving skills.
	Proficiency in logistics software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
	Ability to multitask and work under pressure.
	Location: Must Reside in Warri Delta State or its environs.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Opportunities for professional growth and development.
	A supportive and collaborative work environment.


Application Closing Date: 17th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and credentials to: recruitment@lilyhospitals.net using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
